slides.title: Welcome to ACCA AA
slides.content:
# Audit and Assurance (AA)

AA covers the principles and practice of **external audit**.

## What You Will Learn

- **Audit Framework** - Regulatory environment
- **Planning** - Risk assessment
- **Evidence** - Testing procedures
- **Reporting** - Audit opinions

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Principles | 10% |
| Planning | 20% |
| Internal controls | 15% |
| Audit evidence | 35% |
| Reporting | 20% |

slides.title: Audit Objectives
slides.content:
# Purpose of Audit

## External Audit

Independent examination to give reasonable assurance that financial statements are free from material misstatement.

## Reasonable Assurance

| Not | But |
|-----|-----|
| Absolute | High level |
| Guarantee | Reduces risk |
| 100% | Acceptable level |

## True and Fair View

- Faithful representation
- Complies with framework
- Free from material error

## Audit vs Other Assurance

| Audit | Review |
|-------|--------|
| Reasonable assurance | Limited assurance |
| Positive opinion | Negative opinion |
| Extensive testing | Enquiry and analytical |

slides.title: Audit Risk
slides.content:
# Audit Risk Model

## Formula

```
Audit Risk = IR x CR x DR

IR = Inherent Risk
CR = Control Risk
DR = Detection Risk
```

## Components

| Risk | Meaning |
|------|--------|
| Inherent | Susceptibility to misstatement |
| Control | Controls fail to prevent |
| Detection | Audit procedures miss it |

## Risk Response

| Risk Level | Response |
|------------|----------|
| High IR/CR | More testing |
| Low IR/CR | Less testing |

## Auditor Controls

Auditor can only control Detection Risk:
- More procedures
- Larger samples
- More experienced staff

slides.title: Materiality
slides.content:
# Materiality

## Definition

An amount that would influence user decisions.

## Setting Materiality

| Benchmark | % Range |
|-----------|--------|
| Profit before tax | 5-10% |
| Revenue | 0.5-1% |
| Total assets | 1-2% |
| Equity | 1-2% |

## Performance Materiality

```
Overall materiality x %
= Performance materiality

Used for testing
(to allow for undetected errors)
```

## Trivial Errors

```
Overall materiality x 5%
= Clearly trivial threshold

Below this: not accumulated
```

slides.title: Audit Evidence
slides.content:
# Audit Evidence

## Evidence Qualities

| Quality | Meaning |
|---------|--------|
| Sufficient | Quantity |
| Appropriate | Quality (relevant + reliable) |

## Sources

| Source | Reliability |
|--------|------------|
| External | More reliable |
| Internal (controlled) | Moderate |
| Internal (weak controls) | Less reliable |

## Assertions

| Transactions | Balances |
|--------------|----------|
| Occurrence | Existence |
| Completeness | Completeness |
| Accuracy | Valuation |
| Cut-off | Rights/obligations |
| Classification | Classification |

slides.title: Audit Procedures
slides.content:
# Procedures for Evidence

## Types of Procedures

| Procedure | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| Inspection | Examine records/assets |
| Observation | Watch process |
| Enquiry | Ask questions |
| Confirmation | Third party response |
| Recalculation | Check arithmetic |
| Reperformance | Redo procedure |
| Analytical | Compare/analyze |

## Directional Testing

| Test From | Tests For |
|-----------|----------|
| Source to records | Completeness |
| Records to source | Existence/occurrence |

## Sampling

- Statistical
- Non-statistical
- Sample selection methods

slides.title: Completion
slides.content:
# Audit Completion

## Completion Procedures

| Procedure | Purpose |
|-----------|--------|
| Going concern | Assess continuity |
| Subsequent events | Post year-end |
| Written representations | Management confirmations |
| Overall review | Final assessment |

## Going Concern

Assess 12 months from approval date.

| Indicators | Examples |
|------------|----------|
| Financial | Net liabilities, losses |
| Operational | Key staff leaving |
| Other | Legal issues |

## Representations

- Management acknowledges responsibility
- Confirms specific matters
- Not substitute for evidence

slides.title: Completion Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: For how long from the approval date should going concern be assessed?

slides.title: Audit Reports
slides.content:
# Auditor's Report

## Report Contents

- Opinion paragraph
- Basis for opinion
- Going concern
- Key audit matters
- Responsibilities

## Types of Opinion

| Opinion | When |
|---------|------|
| Unmodified | No issues |
| Qualified | Material but not pervasive |
| Adverse | Material and pervasive (misstatement) |
| Disclaimer | Material and pervasive (limitation) |

## Emphasis of Matter

- Draw attention to matter
- Properly disclosed
- Does not modify opinion

## Key Audit Matters

- Most significant matters
- Listed companies
- Professional judgment
